logic.logicTransfer

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.logicTransfer.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GUI2Game

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements GUI2Game
    Class to organize the whole game procedure

      void moveBoard(Board.Direction dir)
      Moves Board one box in the given direction
      void selectDomOnCurrBank(int idx)
      Human selects a domino on the gui: It's the beginning of the game - Human Player selects a domino from the current round bank (given idx) - Players after Human in the array also select a domino, the label to show who's turn is always updated - Players who selected lower value cards each select a domino on the next round bank and display it on the gui
      void selectDomOnNextBank(int idx)
      Human selects a domino on the gui: Game has already started - Human Player selects a domino from the next round bank (given idx) - Human Player get's his selected domino from the current round bank and puts it as the current domino - Gui displays current domino
      void setOnBoard(Pos pos)
      - Player lays domino on the board - Iterate through current round bank getting the players, as long as it's not the human player: - display whos turn - current player selects a domino for the next round - current player gets the domino he selected in the round before - current player does his turn (internally: updatesDomPos(), showOnBoard(), displays it on gui) - if iterated to the end of the current bank the next round will be set up by nextRound()
      void startGame(PlayerType[] playerTypes, int sizeX, int sizeY)
      clears the board. deals the dominos to the banks.
      java.lang.String toFile()
      generates the string representation of the game used in the file format

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(GUIConnector gui,
            int playerCnt)
        creates a game, used for the actual game
        Parameters:
        gui - gui to display the game changes on
        playerCnt - number of players participating in the game

      • Game

        public Game(GUIConnector gui,
            Player[] players,
            int currPlayerIdx,
            Bank currentRoundBank,
            Bank nextRoundBank,
            java.util.List<Domino> stack,
            Domino currDomino)
        Constructor for testing, setting specific players (with their appropriate Board), current / next round bank, and the domino in the rotate box of the human player. Current player MUST hold a valid Board.

        Used to skip startGame method with a specific game

        Parameters:
        gui - gui for the game
        players - players participating in this game
        currPlayerIdx - index of the current player
        currentRoundBank - current round bank
        nextRoundBank - next round bank
        stack - stack of dominos used to fill banks
        currDomino - domino in the rotation box of the human player

      • Game

        public Game(GUIConnector gui,
            java.lang.String input)
        Constructor used for Loading
        Parameters:
        gui - gui reference to the game
        input - String input setting up the whole game

      • startGame

        public void startGame(PlayerType[] playerTypes,
                      int sizeX,
                      int sizeY)
        Description copied from interface: GUI2Game
        clears the board. deals the dominos to the banks.
        gets one of the stacks dominos and sets it to the middle of the board.
        human player starts.
        Specified by:
        startGame in interface GUI2Game
        Parameters:
        playerTypes - array of playertypes that will be instanciated during the starting process of the game
        sizeX - width of every players' board
        sizeY - height of the players' board

      • selectDomOnCurrBank

        public void selectDomOnCurrBank(int idx)
        Human selects a domino on the gui: It's the beginning of the game - Human Player selects a domino from the current round bank (given idx) - Players after Human in the array also select a domino, the label to show who's turn is always updated - Players who selected lower value cards each select a domino on the next round bank and display it on the gui

        Specified by:
        selectDomOnCurrBank in interface GUI2Game
        Parameters:
        idx - Index of the domino selected by the Human-Player

      • selectDomOnNextBank

        public void selectDomOnNextBank(int idx)
        Human selects a domino on the gui: Game has already started - Human Player selects a domino from the next round bank (given idx) - Human Player get's his selected domino from the current round bank and puts it as the current domino - Gui displays current domino
        Specified by:
        selectDomOnNextBank in interface GUI2Game
        Parameters:
        idx - index of the domino the human player wants to select on the next round bank

      • setOnBoard

        public void setOnBoard(Pos pos)
        - Player lays domino on the board - Iterate through current round bank getting the players, as long as it's not the human player: - display whos turn - current player selects a domino for the next round - current player gets the domino he selected in the round before - current player does his turn (internally: updatesDomPos(), showOnBoard(), displays it on gui) - if iterated to the end of the current bank the next round will be set up by nextRound()
        Specified by:
        setOnBoard in interface GUI2Game
        Parameters:
        pos - position where the Human player wants to display his current domino

      • boxClicked

        public void boxClicked()
        Description copied from interface: GUI2Game
        the current Domino (that is shown in choose-box) is rotated by 90 degrees clockwise and shown. If the clickOnPlayersBank-box is empty and a cell of the current players bank is empty a new domino is dealt and shown in the box. If the choose-box is empty and the players bank full, the next player is to move.
        Specified by:
        boxClicked in interface GUI2Game

      • fits

        public boolean fits(Pos pos)
        Description copied from interface: GUI2Game
        checks if the current chosen domino fits at the position.
        Specified by:
        fits in interface GUI2Game
        Parameters:
        pos - position describes the top-left halfs position
        Returns:
        true, if the current chosen domino fits at the position.

        Moves Board one box in the given direction
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        dir - direction to which the board will be moved
